name: Canna Bali
address: Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1:
A solid place.

It‚Äôs a quiet lunch but all the food we ordered has fresh ingredients with generous portions.

They don‚Äôt skimp. I ordered Foie Gras and it was a larger portion than a typical portion in most places while having a reasonable price.

The place is quiet, the beach is beautiful, the food is excellent. Do come here if you like a more private beach club experience
review 2: It‚Äôs a pleasant place to enjoy the day! Highly recommended to spend some time alone, coupled or even with family. The foods and beverages are excellent. Moreover, the ambience is homey, and the help of the staffs are abundant.
review 3: Gorgeous beachside experience. Two great pools and lovely white sand. Food is well priced and staff are friendly and helpful ü•∞
review 4:
Came here from afternoon until evening. had nice experience, services and food. especially service from Yoga.
for sure will come again and recommend to others
cheers ü•Ç‚ú®
review 5:
The most comfy beach club in Bali by far. The beach is clean with floating jetty where I can walk my kids around the ocean.
Food is 10/10 üëåüèº
We ordered some pizzas and spaghetti, and the friendly staffs gave us fruit platter and gorengan complimentary.
Price was OK
And the nicest thing is they have a mushola üëèüèªüëèüèªüëèüèª

name: Samabe Bali Suites & Villas
address: Jl. Pura, Barong - Barong Sawangan, Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
types: resort_hotel, wedding_venue, event_venue, hotel, lodging, restaurant, food
review 1:
We absolutely loved our experience at Samabe. If you are looking for a relaxing and luxurious stay, there is no better place. From the yoga on the beach with July to the head massages with cucumber by the pool, this hotel knows how to make you feel special.

We stayed in the honeymoon suite and it didn't disappoint. The room was a great size and was decorated nicely. The beach was quiet and peaceful. Their gardens are beautiful and very zen like, and the pool area was just stunning!!

The staff are extremely friendly and accommodating and the use of their butler service was very helpful.

Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer! If you book Samabe you won't regret it.
review 2: We had the most amazing and relaxing holiday at Samabe. The service was incredible and staff were so attentive. The venue was magnificent - we felt like we were in another world. The food was delicious with a fantastic variety. We really enjoyed the guest activities and services as well - cooking classes, fruit carving, jamu making, gym, massages. Highly recommended and hope to be back soon!
review 3: We‚Äôve stayed here twice now and it‚Äôs a fantastic resort! The pool villas are like a personal oasis, the resort is tropical and spacious and the staff are  phenomenal. Also, there are numerous activities on offer to make your stay more interesting and extra special. The restaurants offer a wide variety of food to accommodate all tastes and the overall experience is second to none. I highly recommend this resort.
review 4: If I could give this hotel more stars, I would! This place exceeded our expectations. The service was incredible and the use of the E Butler service on WhatsApp was brilliant. Whatever we needed, we would use the app to contact reception and in less than a minute one of the staff would respond every time. They were so respectful towards myself and my husband, with warm greetings everytime the staff passed us. The hotel room was serviced twice a day and each time our room was left spotless. The free usage of kayaks and paddle boards were a hit and we loved the little freebies provided by the hotel. We were left in awe of the place and will definitely be back. We would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in Nusa Dua. They won‚Äôt disappoint!
review 5:
We came here for our honeymoon, and it was a trip of a lifetime. The staff were absolutely amazing and so friendly, the ebutler was so nice, and the entire place is just breathtaking. I will tell anyone I know they need to put this place on their bucket list. It was totally worth the 26 hours of flying to get here and every penny. Our favorite staff were Putra, Susi, Ayu, Roby and Febri!

We stayed in a honeymoon suite and watched the sunrise over the beach every morning!

name: Ulu Segara Luxury Suites & Villas
address: Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1:
We were so lucky to have stayed in the most amazing private villa here - it was huge with a separate living area from the bedroom and bathroom area.  The private pool was a highlight and where we spent a lot of time watching the para gliders overhead.
Everything was so clean and well looked after and the staff went above and beyond with any request.  A very friendly place to stay with a fantastic buffet breakfast supplied each morning, overlooking the beautiful Indian Ocean.
Ulu Segara also offer many activities like Balinese dress up and offerings - highly recommend this.  We were looked after for most of the afternoon by the very sweet Ari who taught us so much about the local culture.
The large pool at the front of the property is also fantastic, with a swim up bar - thanks to Riko for being the kindest and sweetest person to ever make us some cocktails!  The Beach Bar is kind of hidden away slightly but is also a perfect location for cocktails and some chilled tunes.
It was a short drive away (5-10 mins maximum) from the main Nusa Dua area, however shuttle buses were offered for people wanting to head into the Bali Collection.  The peace and quiet of the whole area was so relaxing. Wished we had been able to stay here for longer, we will be back.
review 2:
I would say that the service is 6üåü and even beyond. Fantastic service all round.
What I didn‚Äôt quite like was the location as it was quite difficult to get around. Even accessing the front lobby from the room required a buggy unless you walk out and up. For those with senior citizens, you may want to avoid this villa. The front steps to the lobby itself are very non-friendly to seniors. The pool looked nice and I had the nicest times lounging next to the pool. The breakfast selection is quite limited so if you manage your expectations, it‚Äôs all good. The rooms are huge and the view was magnificent. The thing that was mind boggling to me was that there seems to be a sheen of water over every surface, which I am not sure why. Is it because it‚Äôs by the sea? The water from the tap is salty so it‚Äôs saltwater, which is fine, just don‚Äôt use that to boil otherwise you will have salted coffee and tea.
But as I said, fantastic service from every personnel. They were really really attentive.
Oh it‚Äôs located next to the parasailing ü™Ç Centre, if you have time, should definitely check it out.
review 3: Probably the only unblocked sea facing hotel with reasonable room rates along this part of the coast. Room is very big at 100m¬≤. Full height window and a long balcony with full sea view. You wouldn't want to miss the Sunrise moment here. Walk down to the beach, it's not crowded, the area here is sheltered from the big waves further out, so it's calm and clear during low tide.  You'll find some Fish and crabs here. We enjoyed our welcome drinks at the little beach club. Breakfast is more to Asian buffet style. Free buggy rides within the resort, and free shuttle van to Bali Connection too. Amazing!
review 4:
Hard to rate this resort.  On one had the suite rooms with the balcony are very nice.  Beautiful view and the suite itself is great.  Unfortunately nothing else is exceptional. It advertises itself as a 5* resort‚Ä¶. but not even close.  Breakfast is average, not great but not bad.  Limited selection and boring.  Room service is fast, but on the more expensive side and the portion sizes tiny. Annoying. The water provided in the rooms is extremely limited and they only offer these small little ghetto bottles (not even properly sealed) throughout the entire resort.  Bali is a hot tropical island, they really need to offer more for guests.

Housekeeping did a good job, but there are 100 stains on literally every single piece of furniture.  Even the drapes have tons of stains on them.  5 star resort ‚Ä¶ ?‚Ä¶.  This feels like someone wanted to build an upscale hotel, but then quit half way through. And gave up.  The beach bar is boring and limited. The bartender there is a random dude who doesn‚Äôt know a single thing. Disappointing. Everything about this hotel is disappointing, except for the room and the view, both of which are very nice.

Pool area needs attention. So many bugs, all over the place.  Why doesn‚Äôt anyone clean up?

Service average. Standard.

Beach outside‚Ä¶. Forgotten.  The stairs walking down have been abandoned and construction unfinished - looks like for a decade.  Garbage everywhere, and the same garbage, so they don‚Äôt even clean it up each day. Strange. Local fishermen hangout on the abandoned steps into the ocean, and they just leave their garbage there.  No one
Picks it up. And the fishermen fish in the ocean right in front of the resort, making swimming there kind of awkward.  I don‚Äôt want to get a hook in my face when I‚Äôm swimming. Actually I kind of liked watching them fish (no big fish, they only catch tiny little ones) - in the island of Bali where everything is catering for tourists, they were the only real authentic thing I saw.

I liked watching the fishermen, and the nice suite, but all the little details are a fail at this resort.  Disappointing.

I wouldn‚Äôt come back here.
review 5: We stayed for 2 nights and were amazed with everything we had there (except the breakfast). I love the location which is quiet. Love the view from our suite room which is unbelievably gorgeous! Room is so spacious and clean. The service is good. They have private beach as well. The swimming pool is amazing! Love to stay again there without the breakfast. Yeah. The breakfast menu is so basic. Not many options. Please revise the menu and improve its quality. I found some sushi & fried spring roll steamed.. so weird. But other than breakfast, everything is EXCELLENT! Bravo!!!

name: Glamp Nusa
address: Jl. Villa Shanti, Lingkungan Sawangan Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80361, Indonesia
review 1:
Glamp Nusa provides new experience to enjoy Nusa Dua - through Glamping! Located in the same cliff stretch with many world class result such as Kempinski and Ritz Carlton, view from the establishment is amazing.

Glamp Nusa will be an amazing place for wedding and private events due to its strategic location and experienced team who runs Bali Beach Glamping.
review 2:
Original and gracious !

Everything about it is well thought out to live a unique experience in Bali from the accommodation high end tents, to the view over the edge of the cliff with an astounding view on the sea and the people, the food, the massages‚Ä¶
review 4:
Everything is so iconic here! The tents are unique, the incredible view from the infinity pool with paragliders around! Just stunning!
And hearing the distant sound of the ocean at night is soothing!
Price are so much cheaper than literally anything with that level of quality and location! And the massage was my best until now. I would recommend to anyone!

name: Cliff at Canna Bali
address: Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1:
An absolute gem perched a top the cliffs of south Kuta, Bali! Its a perfect blend of exquisite cuisine and breathtaking views. From the moment you step in, you're enveloped in a chic yet serene ambiance that sets the stage for a memorable dining experience.

The food? Absolutely divine! Each dish is a culinary masterpiece, bursting with flavors that tantalize the taste buds. The panoramic views they're simply mesmerizing! this place is a must-visit. Super highly recommended!
review 2: Last week, we had the pleasure of attending the enchanting ‚ÄúMagical Six‚Äù dinner at @cliffatcannabali . We were truly captivated by the breathtaking view, the warmth of the attendees, and the culinary mastery displayed by six exceptionally talented chefs. It was an experience that left us in awe, and we are grateful to have been a part of such an extraordinary event.
review 3:
The best food we have ever had! Not to mention the view, service and styling were elite.
We even tried googling the playlist, couldn‚Äôt fault a thing
review 4: A wonderful dining experience, from the moment we stepped through the door, we were greeted with warmth and elegance. Really loved the ambience with a direct ocean view, its like added an extra layer of magic, making it the perfect memorable dinner. Every dish was a work of art, showcasing the chef's skill and creativity. The attentive service only added to the overall perfection of the evening. Highly recommend for anyone looking wonderful cuisine and impeccable hospitality."
review 5: Amazing place with good food and great atmosphere. We absolutely loved it. The music and ambiance was great and we really enjoyed their cocktails too. Came for a special event and they made it extra special. Highly recommend it.

name: Samabe Cave Dining
address: Unnamed Road, 5686+4R7, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: The whole experience is magical. We are on our honeymoon and was looking for a romantic dinner and this is just phenomenal. The food, the location, the ambiance and the staff are all amazing and made our night perfect. We are so happy with everything and will 100% come back to experience it all again on our anniversary
review 2: Best romantic dinner ever and worth to try. Thank you Mr. Putra for your assistance to arrange the birthday surprise with my husband. Great service, venue, and food of course !!  üíØüíØüíØü©∑ü©∑ü©∑ü©∑
review 3:
Food was good,
But the service is one of the most terrible experience I ever had.

The waiter put multiple courses into one plate,
And there were multiple missing items

The steak was supposed to come with fondant potatoe
And the prawn should come witg saffron risitto and shaved truffle.
Cod should come with sides too.

Instead we got a big plate with all the main course in there and no sides

And one of the dessert that should come after also got served prior to the cod and steak

I'm not impressed at all
review 4:
We had a dinner there after our wedding . That was absolutely above our expectation.
Food was delicious and service absolutely amazing ü•∞ Thank you very much for made our day special with this romantic climateüòç
review 5: Everything was great! Ambience, food, service, view, üëçüëç.

name: Natan Beach
address: 5675+C5F, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: Stunning, secluded, picture-perfect beach if it weren‚Äôt for some rubbish washed up on the shore by high tide. Also, for some reason, the wet sand was very unstable and it was very difficult to walk along the beach as I was sinking in deep with each step. But still a gorgeous beach!
review 2: Probably nice, not really accessible unless you climb through thick Bush down a vertical slope

name: Cave at Canna Bali
address: Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1: Everything was super good until we ordered shots and we asked one of the waitress to add the bill to our table at Luna‚Äôs. she was so so so rude and said ‚Äú can you pay the bill , you have to pay here its just a small amount ‚Äú ??? Whatt??? We paid exactly 700k for 4 shots i dont think that was small? Especially for a shot. Didnt mind the bill just asked if we could add it to the Luna‚Äôs bill and that was her response. Annoying and rude :) but over all love the place love the bartenders!!
review 2:
Have a long drive from jungle to Nusa Dua and it pays off this amazing place.
The recommended beach club in Nusa Dua areas.
Will be back soon with someoneüòç
review 3: Great ambiance, service, music, not crazy crowded. Only things i don't like is they open only Friday and Saturday üòÖ i would like to go more often.
review 4: Amazing place.. Got the vibe.. If your in Bali it's a must visit place.. ambience decor bar everything is best
review 5: The best night club ive been to in the Nusa Dua area!

name: Ulu Segara Restaurant & Bar
address: 5686+49R, Jl. Raya Nusa Dua Selatan, Nusa Dua, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali 80363, Indonesia
review 1: Taste 3/5 (maybe my standards, coming from Canggu are too high. Definitely don't order the salads), Health 4/5, Service Quality 2/5 (ex: bring soup with no spoons?), Service Speed 2/5 (order drink before get food & never received, even after finish food!), Interior 3/5, View 6/5!, Cleanliness 4/5, Food Value 4/5, Drink Value 3/5.
review 2: A stunning ocean view experience a vibrant and tranquility one of the most popular beaches in Bali. kids friendly, cozy place. And the food and drinks are really good.

name: Pantai barong barong
address: 5687+9C9, Benoa, South Kuta, Badung Regency, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: Sadly Canna Bali have closed the stairs to the beach. I'm not sure if they're even allowed to do that. You also have to pay 2.000 for parking.
review 2: Canna Bali has closed the access to this public beach .. can no longer use the stairs that were there for 100s of years SAD! BIG RICH PEOPLE BUYING BEACH ACCESS
review 3: The access to the beach has been blocked by the owners of the Canna beach club! The beach is public, but it has been taken over by the wealthy. Who gave them permission?

name: Rempah Rempah Restaurant
address: Samabe Bali Resort and Villas, 5686+WF3, Jl. Pura Barong Barong, Sawangan, Nusa Dua, Benoa, Kec. Kuta Sel., Kabupaten Badung, Bali, Indonesia
review 1: Came here for menu tasting and was impressed by the food. Meats / steaks were well cooked, lobster is fresh and big sized. Oxtail soup was savoury. I would imagine the other dishes here are also good.
review 2:
Stayed in the Villas and reserved an evening of rijsttafel accompanied by traditional dance and craft market. The combined dinner and dance was a fantastic way to enjoy some of the cultural flavors of Bali without leaving the property.

The restaurant was spacious with table and daybed seating. We received a table with unobstructed views of the performances. We enjoyed a stroll of the nearby craft market offering a wide variety of local handmade products before the dinner started.

Our dinner table was decorated with handmade leaf foldings and flanked by 2 fresh coconuts. We received a long tray of local spiced dips and paste to accompany various crackers to open the dinner. The various "rempahs" commonly found in Indonesian and Balinese cuisine was wonderful.

We also had Gado Gado and soup made from Banana stems. The main course featured 6 different dishes of meat and vegetables accompanied with steamed rice. A trio of Indonesian desserts closed the dinner on a sweet note. Service was attentive and friendly with the hallmark Samabe smiles all around.

In between the courses, there was the Legong dance performance with a variety of dances and costumes that spoke of Balinese myths and legends. They were delivered by children and young adults. We were also invited to have a photo taken with the dancers at the end of the performance.

What an excellent evening!
review 3: One of the best restaurants in the Sawangan area. I especially loved the variety of breakfast dishes.
review 4: This is the best Indonesian street food I‚Äôve had in Bali (stayed 6 months Uluwatu/Ubud/Canggu), or anywhere. Huge menu and generous portions. Clean and well-presented. It‚Äôs worth coming to Bali specifically to eat at this restaurant.
review 5: The food taste very good. Great view. Attentive and friendly staff.
